{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant / Manager",
  "description": "Cee Consult performs several HR services Like: Recruitment, Employee Key Performance Index/Appraisal, Employee Labor Law Relations &amp; Compliance, HR Information and Payroll Management and Training And Development/Career Management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant / Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Type:Full Time

Summary


	The Accountant is responsible for billing various services and products, performing general ledger account and bank statement reconciliation, preparing journal entries and financial statements, creating and maintaining periodic reporting, maintaining fixed asset system, assisting with annual budgeting, compiling grant applications and expenditures reporting, preparing statistical and financial reports for creditors and agencies, maintaining records retention, and assisting the Chief Financial Officer in preparation of miscellaneous confidential correspondence.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Full charge bookkeeping including all month and year end journal entries.
	Compilation and preparation of monthly, quarterly and yearly financial statements for in?house use and CPA firm for yearend tax purposes and decision making.
	Maintain employee records including but not limited to hours, salary, mileage and personal time off, etc.
	Process payroll semi?monthly, file all payroll taxes and forms monthly, quarterly and yearly as required by Federal and State laws.
	Maintain payroll files and reports.
	Manage Timeslips program including but not limited to reviewing and downloading time, checking for accuracy and proof/edit as needed.
	Maintain the program and update as needed.
	Maintain all client accounts of time, billings and payments.
	Collection of accounts receivable when necessary.
	Keeping records and tracking of all company assets purchased and in use. Update records when assets are removed and no longer in use.
	Report to CPA.
	Prepare all monthly client invoicing and vendor payments for management team approval and mailing.
	Reconcile credit card receipts and statements monthly.
	Track credit card receipts for client invoicing and pay cards in a timely manner.
	Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly reports and financial analysis reports including but not limited to financial statements, client budget reports, employee time challenge reports, part?time employee hours report, employee financial profit share report, accounts receivable reports, etc.
	Responsible for follow up phone calls/emails and letters to track billing records, payment requests, bank statements, anything financial that needs follow?up, etc.
	Prepare and maintain government client reporting and estimating.
	Provide advice and assistance in making decisions in the areas of finances, analysis, financial software and accounting as requested by management.
	Working cooperatively with the company&rsquo;s certified public accounting and insurance firms.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s / Master&#39;s degree in Accounting required, ICAN Preferred.
	Minimum two or more years&rsquo; experience in accounting or related business area.
	Proven track record of good communication skills.
	Proficient in spreadsheet software (Excel) and Word and quick books
	Access and Accounting Software knowledge preferred.


Ability to:


	Meet deadlines and prioritize tasks; work efficiently with minimal supervision; detailed oriented.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 Monthly.&nbsp;(ICAN only)

Method of Applicatopn
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;ceeconsultrecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-08-27",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Accountant / Manager Job at Cee Consult




        
    

        
        Cee Consult performs several HR services Like: Recruitment, Employee Key Performance Index/Appraisal, Employee Labor Law Relations & Compliance, HR Information and Payroll Management and Training And Development/Career Management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant / Manager
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Job Type:Full Time

Summary
     

            
    




	The Accountant is responsible for billing various services and products, performing general ledger account and bank statement reconciliation, preparing journal entries and financial statements, creating and maintaining periodic reporting, maintaining fixed asset system, assisting with annual budgeting, compiling grant applications and expenditures reporting, preparing statistical and financial reports for creditors and agencies, maintaining records retention, and assisting the Chief Financial Officer in preparation of miscellaneous confidential correspondence.


Duties and Responsibilities


	Full charge bookkeeping including all month and year end journal entries.
	Compilation and preparation of monthly, quarterly and yearly financial statements for in?house use and CPA firm for yearend tax purposes and decision making.
	Maintain employee records including but not limited to hours, salary, mileage and personal time off, etc.
	Process payroll semi?monthly, file all payroll taxes and forms monthly, quarterly and yearly as required by Federal and State laws.
	Maintain payroll files and reports.
	Manage Timeslips program including but not limited to reviewing and downloading time, checking for accuracy and proof/edit as needed.
	Maintain the program and update as needed.
	Maintain all client accounts of time, billings and payments.
	Collection of accounts receivable when necessary.
	Keeping records and tracking of all company assets purchased and in use. Update records when assets are removed and no longer in use.
	Report to CPA.
	Prepare all monthly client invoicing and vendor payments for management team approval and mailing.
	Reconcile credit card receipts and statements monthly.
	Track credit card receipts for client invoicing and pay cards in a timely manner.
	Prepare weekly, monthly, quarterly reports and financial analysis reports including but not limited to financial statements, client budget reports, employee time challenge reports, part?time employee hours report, employee financial profit share report, accounts receivable reports, etc.
	Responsible for follow up phone calls/emails and letters to track billing records, payment requests, bank statements, anything financial that needs follow?up, etc.
	Prepare and maintain government client reporting and estimating.
	Provide advice and assistance in making decisions in the areas of finances, analysis, financial software and accounting as requested by management.
	Working cooperatively with the company’s certified public accounting and insurance firms.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s / Master's degree in Accounting required, ICAN Preferred.
	Minimum two or more years’ experience in accounting or related business area.
	Proven track record of good communication skills.
	Proficient in spreadsheet software (Excel) and Word and quick books
	Access and Accounting Software knowledge preferred.


Ability to:


	Meet deadlines and prioritize tasks; work efficiently with minimal supervision; detailed oriented.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 Monthly. (ICAN only)

Method of Applicatopn
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: ceeconsultrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Receptionist / Social Media Officer",
  "description": "Pruvia Integrated Limited is a human resources and management firm with a strong desire to ensure customer satisfaction in the midst of efficient and effective service delivery. As an organization, we are driven by the dictum of &lsquo;Impossibility is Nothing&rsquo;. Our clients represent the entire spectrum of the Commerce, Hospitality, Information technology, Media, Finance &amp; Insurance Sector, Automobile, Oil &amp; Gas Sector, Real Estate, Manufacturing, FMCG and Small and Medium Enterprises and Communications industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist / Social Media Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic, organized, and creative individual to join our team as a Receptionist and Social Media Coordinator. This role combines front-office duties, administrative support, and the responsibility for managing and creating content for the company&rsquo;s social media platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet visitors and clients with a warm, professional demeanor.
	Answer, screen, and direct incoming calls to the appropriate departments or personnel.
	Maintain a clean and organized front desk area.
	Receive, sort, and distribute mail, packages, and deliveries.
	Schedule and coordinate appointments, meetings, and conference room bookings.
	Assist with the preparation, filing, and maintenance of company documents and records.
	Perform data entry tasks to ensure accurate record-keeping and filing systems.
	Prepare reports, presentations, and other documents as requested by management.
	Maintain a log of visitors and employees entering and exiting the building.
	Ensure all visitors follow the required security protocols.
	Assist in managing office supplies, ordering new items when necessary.
	Coordinate and schedule company meetings, travel, and events.
	Provide general office administrative support, including photocopying, scanning, and faxing.


Social Media Coordinator Duties:


	Develop, create, and schedule content for social media platforms that align with the company&rsquo;s brand and marketing objectives.
	Engage with followers and respond to inquiries promptly, maintaining a positive brand image.
	Monitor and analyze social media trends and competitors to ensure our content stays relevant and engaging.
	Track and report on social media metrics, creating regular reports on engagement, reach, and campaign effectiveness.
	Coordinate with the marketing team to ensure alignment with marketing strategies and goals.
	Organize and manage social media campaigns, contests, and promotions.
	Ensure consistent branding and messaging across all social media platforms.


Skills and Qualifications


	HND/BSc in Office Administration, Social Media Marketing, or a related field is preferred.
	Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in a receptionist or administrative assistant role.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and social media platforms and management tools (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter).
	Strong written and verbal communication skills with a creative and engaging writing style.
	Knowledge of basic social media analytics and reporting.
	Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and problem-solving abilities.
	Creative, with the ability to think outside the box for social media content.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified applicants should send their CV to:&nbsp;pruvia.career@gmail.com&nbsp;or&nbsp;jobpruvia@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-08-31",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Pruvia Integrated Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

Receptionist / Social Media Officer Job at Pruvia Integrated Limited




        
    

        
        Pruvia Integrated Limited is a human resources and management firm with a strong desire to ensure customer satisfaction in the midst of efficient and effective service delivery. As an organization, we are driven by the dictum of ‘Impossibility is Nothing’. Our clients represent the entire spectrum of the Commerce, Hospitality, Information technology, Media, Finance & Insurance Sector, Automobile, Oil & Gas Sector, Real Estate, Manufacturing, FMCG and Small and Medium Enterprises and Communications industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Receptionist / Social Media Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic, organized, and creative individual to join our team as a Receptionist and Social Media Coordinator. This role combines front-office duties, administrative support, and the responsibility for managing and creating content for the company’s social media platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet visitors and clients with a warm, professional demeanor.
	Answer, screen, and direct incoming calls to the appropriate departments or personnel.
	Maintain a clean and organized front desk area.
	Receive, sort, and distribute mail, packages, and deliveries.
	Schedule and coordinate appointments, meetings, and conference room bookings.
	Assist with the preparation, filing, and maintenance of company documents and records.
	Perform data entry tasks to ensure accurate record-keeping and filing systems.
	Prepare reports, presentations, and other documents as requested by management.
	Maintain a log of visitors and employees entering and exiting the building.
	Ensure all visitors follow the required security protocols.
	Assist in managing office supplies, ordering new items when necessary.
	Coordinate and schedule company meetings, travel, and events.
	Provide general office administrative support, including photocopying, scanning, and faxing.


Social Media Coordinator Duties:


	Develop, create, and schedule content for social media platforms that align with the company’s brand and marketing objectives.
	Engage with followers and respond to inquiries promptly, maintaining a positive brand image.
	Monitor and analyze social media trends and competitors to ensure our content stays relevant and engaging.
	Track and report on social media metrics, creating regular reports on engagement, reach, and campaign effectiveness.
	Coordinate with the marketing team to ensure alignment with marketing strategies and goals.
	Organize and manage social media campaigns, contests, and promotions.
	Ensure consistent branding and messaging across all social media platforms.


Skills and Qualifications


	HND/BSc in Office Administration, Social Media Marketing, or a related field is preferred.
	Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in a receptionist or administrative assistant role.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and social media platforms and management tools (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter).
	Strong written and verbal communication skills with a creative and engaging writing style.
	Knowledge of basic social media analytics and reporting.
	Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
	Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and problem-solving abilities.
	Creative, with the ability to think outside the box for social media content.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified applicants should send their CV to: pruvia.career@gmail.com or jobpruvia@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

	Well spoken and goal oriented

Social Media Personnel Job at Cee Consult




        
    

        
        Cee Consult performs several HR services Like: Recruitment, Employee Key Performance Index/Appraisal, Employee Labor Law Relations & Compliance, HR Information and Payroll Management and Training And Development/Career Management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Personnel

Job Location: Ajah, Lagos

Requirements
     

            
    




	Interested candidates should possess an HND / B.Sc Degree with 1 - 2 years of relevant experience. 
	Must have knowledge on social media platforms
	Know how to create contents and edit Videos
	Well spoken and goal oriented
	Good communication skills
	Have basic knowledge on graphic designing.


Work days:


	Monday: 8:30am to 12:30pm
	Tuesday: 8:00 to 5pm
	Wednesday: 8:30am to 2pm
	No Thursday and Friday
	Saturday is occasional.


Salary
N60,000 per month. 

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: Ceeconsultrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "HR Generalist",
  "description": "CCLE Rubber FZE is a leading Tyre and Tube Manufacturing company committed to producing top-quality products for diverse markets. We pride ourselves on innovation, customer satisfaction, and expanding our reach into new regions. To support this growth, we are looking to add a dynamic Field Sales Assistant to our team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Generalist
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Retail / FMCG
Start Date: Immediate

About the Role


	We are seeking a dynamic and experienced HR Generalist to join our growing team.
	The ideal candidate will play a key role in supporting day-to-day HR operations, ensuring smooth execution of HR functions, and promoting a positive and compliant work environment.
	This role requires a blend of administrative competence, interpersonal skills, and hands-on HR knowledge.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the recruitment and onboarding process for new employees
	Maintain and update employee records and HR databases
	Handle employee relations, conflict resolution, and grievance procedures
	Support disciplinary processes and documentation
	Prepare HR reports and provide data analysis for management
	Coordinate training, team bonding, and wellness activities
	Administer benefits programs, payroll processing support, and attendance tracking
	Oversee performance appraisal cycles and support employee development initiatives
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian Labour Laws, Factory Act, and internal HR policies
	Contribute to policy reviews and organizational culture improvement


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Admin, Industrial Relations, or related field
	2&ndash;4 years of HR generalist or officer-level experience
	Strong understanding of Nigerian Labour Law and HR best practices
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills
	Proficiency in MS Office and HRIS tools
	Strong ethical standards and confidentiality
	Professional certifications (e.g., CIPM) are an added advantage


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to:&nbsp;hr@cclerubberafrica.com&nbsp;using &quot;the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-26",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "CCLE Rubber FZE"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "184906"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



HR Generalist Job at CCLE Rubber FZE




        
    

        
        CCLE Rubber FZE is a leading Tyre and Tube Manufacturing company committed to producing top-quality products for diverse markets. We pride ourselves on innovation, customer satisfaction, and expanding our reach into new regions. To support this growth, we are looking to add a dynamic Field Sales Assistant to our team.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR Generalist
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Retail / FMCG
Start Date: Immediate

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dynamic and experienced HR Generalist to join our growing team.
	The ideal candidate will play a key role in supporting day-to-day HR operations, ensuring smooth execution of HR functions, and promoting a positive and compliant work environment.
	This role requires a blend of administrative competence, interpersonal skills, and hands-on HR knowledge.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage the recruitment and onboarding process for new employees
	Maintain and update employee records and HR databases
	Handle employee relations, conflict resolution, and grievance procedures
	Support disciplinary processes and documentation
	Prepare HR reports and provide data analysis for management
	Coordinate training, team bonding, and wellness activities
	Administer benefits programs, payroll processing support, and attendance tracking
	Oversee performance appraisal cycles and support employee development initiatives
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian Labour Laws, Factory Act, and internal HR policies
	Contribute to policy reviews and organizational culture improvement


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Admin, Industrial Relations, or related field
	2–4 years of HR generalist or officer-level experience
	Strong understanding of Nigerian Labour Law and HR best practices
	Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills
	Proficiency in MS Office and HRIS tools
	Strong ethical standards and confidentiality
	Professional certifications (e.g., CIPM) are an added advantage


Salary
N150,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume to: hr@cclerubberafrica.com using "the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
